key_points: Eli Manning, former New York Giants quarterback, reflects on his career and his perspective on the current NFL playoffs.
Manning, a two-time Super Bowl winner against Tom Brady and the Patriots, is excited about the Drew Brees vs. Tom Brady matchup in the NFC Divisional round.
Since retiring, Manning has kept a low profile compared to his brother Peyton Manning, engaging in charity work and brand endorsements.
Manning mentions his old teammate Victor Cruz and their involvement with Stella Stadium Bites, a Super Bowl food ideas initiative.
Discusses his rivalry with Tom Brady, emphasizing team effort in their Super Bowl victories.
Mentions the importance of playing smart football against teams like the Patriots.
Shares his relationship with his brother Peyton, highlighting their football conversations and analysis.
Despite being considered the quieter Manning brother, Eli shares memories of watching Super Bowls with his family and the significance of such moments.
Eli Manning appreciates the opportunity to collaborate with Victor Cruz on Super Bowl-related activities beyond his playing days.
Expresses admiration for the longevity and skill of both Drew Brees and Tom Brady as they continue playing at a high level into their 40s.
